snippet.textDisplay: The request for thumbs almost ruined your comment, but you're absolutely correct. If good games only could have existed "back then", then what's the point of making new games? You wouldn't have this game or a bunch others, not to mention a bunch of arcade titles on XBLA/PSN. So please leave your nostalgic elitism at the door. A fun game is a good game, thank you.

snippet.textDisplay: @yaktr12 You must be one of those guys that think living in the now is what makes you cooler. If you compare Super Mario 64 and the Galaxy games, the amount of tasks you have to do to get a star are either much more involved in the Galaxy games or are more difficult which you probably haven't gotten to since you stopped at the game so early. Retro games are just as good as modern games, and BTW, I never even gotten into the Zelda series but their are tons and tons of video game fans
snippet.textOriginal: @yaktr12 You must be one of those guys that think living in the now is what makes you cooler. snippet.textDisplay: OMG Super Mario 64 was revolutionary for playing games in 3D, it was for many people the first time they played a game where they can roam around a 3D world. I believe the Galaxy series perfected the 3D platforming of the Mario series just like how SMB3 And SMW perfected the 2D side scrolling of the Mario series.
snippet.textOriginal: OMG Super Mario 64 was revolutionary for playing games in 3D, it was for many people the first time they played a game where they can roam around a 3D world. I believe the Galaxy series perfected the 3D platforming of the Mario series just like how SMB3 And SMW perfected the 2D side scrolling of the Mario series.

snippet.textDisplay: @yaktr12 I played Heavy Rain, Oblivion, MGS4, Fallout 3 and SSF4. I can proudly put Mario Galaxy in the league of Metal Gear Solid, Elder Scrolls and Fallout. I don't really know much about Heavy Rain because I just started playing the game but it looks really amazing with all the story. SSF4 had an amazing multiplayer but... I don't put it in that league.

snippet.textDisplay:
@yaktr12 Try pouring the amount of effort you used to beat Portal games. Why should a person try one decent game when he has 70 games? He can always grab another one if it seems to be boring at first look.

By the way, what is your favorite Wii game out of 70+ games on your hacked wii? Mario Galaxy is easily number 1 Wii game and one of the best PS3, Xbox 360 and Wii titles all together.
snippet.textOriginal:
@yaktr12 Try pouring the amount of effort you used to beat Portal games. Why should a person try one decent game when he has 70 games? He can always grab another one if it seems to be boring at first look.

snippet.textDisplay: @yaktr12 MW2 was extremely repetitive for me since I already played CoD4 and I was very familiar with that gameplay. I can't believe some people find CoD still fun but not Mario Galaxy which has an incredible level design, hooking people into the game. Side-scrolling Mario was awesome, but it was still great in 3D since Mario 64. You claimed that you played Portal and also this game before, but I don't think so... You're probably judging games from someone else's opinions without playing it.
snippet.textOriginal: @yaktr12 MW2 was extremely repetitive for me since I already played CoD4 and I was very familiar with that gameplay. I can't believe some people find CoD still fun but not Mario Galaxy which has an incredible level design, hooking people into the game. Side-scrolling Mario was awesome, but it was still great in 3D since Mario 64. You claimed that you played Portal and also this game before, but I don't think so... You're probably judging games from someone else's opinions without playing it.

snippet.textDisplay: @yaktr12 And just shooting at people constantly isn't repetitive either?
snippet.textOriginal: @yaktr12 And just shooting at people constantly isn't repetitive either?

snippet.textDisplay: Both Galaxy games are part of my favorite games this generation. They're certainly my favorite platformers. Now I'm looking forward to Super Mario 3D Land on the 3DS. This is one of the few themes in the game composed by Nagamatsu, he also made the Puzzle Plank Galaxy and the final battle theme.
snippet.textOriginal: Both Galaxy games are part of my favorite games this generation. They're certainly my favorite platformers. Now I'm looking forward to Super Mario 3D Land on the 3DS. This is one of the few themes in the game composed by Nagamatsu, he also made the Puzzle Plank Galaxy and the final battle theme.
